article: It was a freezing, windy winter night in Manhattan. I was walking to catch a train home, totally 36 _ in the next day's to-do list, not paying any attention to my surroundings. "Hey man, I love your nice hat!", said a voice to me from the sidewalk. When I 37 looked back to see where it came from, I saw a man 38 _ dressed, carrying a garbage bag, standing outside a 39 _ --with a warm smile on his face. As I was about to say thank you, a woman walked by. "Hey lady, you have the most beautiful eyes. Can you 40 _ some change?" This homeless man had no 41 _ of talking to anyone and he was excellent at 42 _ up others. I felt pulled to help him use that 43 _ . I introduced myself, and 44 _ him to dinner inside. "Ralph's the name. Thank you so much, sir!", he said. As we sat down and ate, I told Ralph that I felt he has an amazing talent for 45 _ with people. 46 _ at first, he eventually began to open up. He spoke much about how he used to love to 47 _ . He was like a fisherman's encyclopedia . I asked him what he could see himself doing, and he said that he thought he could be a good 48 _ . So I asked him if he ever 49 _ going to the store right down the street and telling them he would help them sell their fishing equipment. There was a pause. Ralph put his hands over his face 50 _ he spoke through tears. I'll never 51 _ what he said next. "I 52 ran away from my problems, man. I had a job and a family. 53 _ , I didn't know how to handle everything. For 11 years, no one has ever done anything like this for me. It's time for me to make things 54 _ again. " By the end, I was in 55 _ as well. Ralph thanked me for my help, and we went our separate ways.
